title: HELP :: Misc. Serif in Italics?
content:
Who knows?  
Also, is the “f” a completely different typeface from the rest of the title?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101019im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/infinity_logo_4331.png)

 [‹ names to these fonts?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48155 "Go to previous forum topic") [This one? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122101019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48169 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pr3ciousroy

comments.content:
The f definitely looks like a custom edit...looks like it’s been edited to make it into an 8, or infinity symbol. The dots on the i’s\* might be custom edited too.

As for font, I dunno. It’s too slanted to be Book Antiqua, although that makes a close approximation otherwise. Close, almost certainly not exact. I’ll leave this for the experts.

\* Note: the only case in English where you’re allowed to pluralize with an apostrophe

Peace,  
JT
okay, I scanned through my system fonts again and have come to the conclusion that it’s Lucida Calligraphy....though obviously not the “f”.

Ah, that makes sense. Well there you go :P

Peace,  
JT
